stories.text:
Hello,

I’m looking for accounting/invoicing software recommendations in Canada (buy once or saas) specific to auto sales and repair shops.
stories.title: Ask HN: Accounting/invoicing software for auto sales/service shops in Canada

stories.text:
I was born too late to witness popularity of XMPP as a decentralized instant messaging protocol. When I started to be a "conscious" user of the Internet, such services already became centralized, so I don't really remember those times. As I follow the development of projects like Matrix, I wonder what has made SMTP such a stable protocol that has stood the test of time and what is the real reason we don't use XMPP (I mean, we do using Whatsapp, but as a part of closed ecosystem).

Is it only that XMPP was overcomplicated and if managed better it would survive? Or is it something else?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why XMPP failed and SMTP didn't?
What are the chances that we've been visited by aliens?
Sick of picking up toys? Dyson’s future home robots want to do it for you
Tomatoes that produce as much Vitamin D as eggs

stories.text:
I've read many times in comments here on HN that the speed of your database is the biggest bottleneck for your server-side web app. Therefore, the speed of your server-side programming language is not important (or less important).

I asked this question in 2019 (3 years ago) and many HN posters said the database was more likely to be a bottleneck than the server-side programming language. Does this still hold true in 2022?

(Here's the original discussion from 2019: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=20123659)
stories.title: Ask HN: Database-driven web apps – is the database still a bottleneck?

stories.text: I created this tool for myself and have been using it every morning for more one year. The list is updated every 10 minutes and new links are added at the top. The links are chosen based on certain criteria like minimum votes and comments.
stories.title: Show HN: Top links from HN, Reddit, Producthunt and Techmeme on one page
